question: The Reserve Bank of India works as a lender of the last resort (LOLR). Which among the following is the correct statement in this context?
option1: RBI meets all the demands of the commercial banks in times of difficulties
option2: RBI meets all the reasonable demands of the commercial banks in times of difficulties
option3: RBI is the last lender to the Government at the centre and the states
option4: RBI grants loans to the banks and also the Governments in states
answer: RBI meets all the reasonable demands of the commercial banks in times of difficulties
explanation: RBI is known as Lender of Last Resort because, banks are supposed to meet their shortfalls of cash from other sources and if the other sources don't meet the demand, then they approach RBI.
